title: Kuma Deliberately Chose Each Island Based on His Prior Visits
theory: Chapter 1099 revealed that Kuma visited many of the islands he sent the Straw Hats to during the time-skip, including Torino Kingdom, while searching for a cure for Bonney's disease. This suggests that Kuma's choice of where to send each crew member wasn't random but carefully considered based on his knowledge of each island and each crew member's needs. The theory proposes that Kuma, believing Luffy resembled Nika and would save the world, intentionally sent each Straw Hat to locations that would help them grow stronger and prepare for the New World.
evidence: Chapter 1099 shows Kuma visiting Torino Kingdom, Kuraigana Island, Karakuri Island, the Boin Archipelago, Tequila Wolf, and Weatheria
Kuma's knowledge of these islands came from his search for a cure for Bonney
Each island provided specific training opportunities matching each crew member's abilities
Kuma admired Nika and believed Luffy embodied Nika's traits and powers

title: Kuma Had Different Sources of Knowledge for Certain Islands
theory: While Chapter 1099 shows Kuma visiting many training islands, it notably doesn't show him visiting Amazon Lily, Namakura Island, or Kamabakka Kingdom - the locations where he sent Luffy, Brook, and Sanji. This gap suggests that Kuma may have obtained information about these specific locations through different means, possibly through his Revolutionary Army connections (especially for Kamabakka Kingdom, which later becomes a Revolutionary Army base), or that some element of luck or Divine Providence was involved in these particular destinations.
evidence: Chapter 1099 doesn't show Kuma visiting Amazon Lily, Namakura Island, or Kamabakka Kingdom
Kamabakka Kingdom has strong Revolutionary Army connections through Emporio Ivankov
Kuma's Revolutionary Army position could have provided intelligence about these locations
Each unvisited location still provided perfect training conditions for the respective crew member

title: Sanji's Time on Momoiro Island Was Designed to Strengthen His Resolve
theory: While Momoiro Island appears to be Sanji's 'worst nightmare,' being constantly chased by okama was actually the perfect training for him. The theory suggests that the constant evasion forced Sanji to develop exceptional leg strength and aerial mobility (Sky Walk), while the psychological challenge of facing his fears helped him overcome his limitations. Some fans theorize that Kuma or the Revolutionary Army knew this would be ideal training for Sanji, despite how traumatic it appears.
evidence: Sanji developed Sky Walk ability during his time on Momoiro Island
Constant evasion significantly enhanced his leg strength and speed
The psychological pressure forced Sanji to push beyond his limits
Kamabakka Kingdom's connection to the Revolutionary Army suggests intentional placement
Sanji's later combat abilities show marked improvement from timeskip training

title: Chopper's Medical Advancement Was Predetermined by Kuma
theory: Kuma specifically sent Chopper to Torino Kingdom knowing about the extensive medical library hidden on the island. The theory suggests that Kuma, during his search for a cure for Bonney's disease, learned about Torino Kingdom's advanced medical knowledge despite the natives' primitive appearance. By sending Chopper there, Kuma ensured that the Straw Hats' doctor would gain the medical expertise needed for the crew's future challenges. This placement was particularly strategic given the dangerous situations the crew would face in the New World.

title: Kamabakka Kingdom's Revolutionary Army Base Was Established Because of Sanji
theory: Some fans theorize that while Kamabakka Kingdom existed before, its designation as the Revolutionary Army's main headquarters after Baltigo's destruction may have been partially influenced by Sanji's presence there. The theory suggests that Dragon and the Revolutionary Army, knowing Sanji was training on the island and was Luffy's crewmate, may have chosen Momoiro Island as their base to maintain a connection to the Straw Hats, whom they see as important allies in fighting the World Government.

The timing of the base relocation coincides with the post-timeskip period
